identified-content.person: BERKMAN, DR. EMILY DEBORAH (DR. EMILY DEBORAH HARRIS)

block.p: Dr. Emily Deborah Berkman, the daughter of Dr. Kathy Berkman and Andrew Berkman of Manhattan, was married last evening to David Brooks Harris, a son of Robie H. Harris and William W. Harris of Cambridge, Mass. Rabbi James Glazier officiated at the Blueberry Hill Inn in Goshen, Vt.
The couple attended Wesleyan, but did not meet until several years after graduation, when they were introduced by a mutual friend, whose mother had introduced the bride's parents.

Dr. Emily Deborah Berkman, the daughter of Dr. Kathy Berkman and Andrew Berkman of Manhattan, was married last evening to David Brooks Harris, a son of Robie H. Harris and William W. Harris of Cambridge, Mass. Rabbi James Glazier officiated at the Blueberry Hill Inn in Goshen, Vt.
The couple attended Wesleyan, but did not meet until several years after graduation, when they were introduced by a mutual friend, whose mother had introduced the bride's parents.

The bride, 29, received an M.D. degree from the Mount Sinai School of Medicine and is now a third-year resident in pediatrics at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx. Her father is a lawyer and an adjunct professor at the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law of Yeshiva University in Manhattan. Her mother is a Manhattan psychiatrist and an assistant professor of psychiatry at Mount Sinai.

The bridegroom, 28, is a partner in the Children's Research and Education Institute, a child advocacy group in Manhattan. He is also a candidate for a Ph.D. in child and family policy at Columbia and a member of Community Board 7. He received a master's degree in early childhood education from Bank Street College of Education. His mother is an author of children's books, including ''It's So Amazing! A Book About Eggs, Sperm, Birth, Babies and Families'' (Candlewick Press, 1999). His father is the founder and treasurer of KidsPac, a political action committee in Cambridge, Mass., that works on human and children's rights issues.
